nl.han.oopd.toadparcour

Class Monster

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.gameengine.icadroids.objects.GameObject
      • android.gameengine.icadroids.objects.MoveableGameObject
        • nl.han.oopd.toadparcour.GravatiyGameObject
          • nl.han.oopd.toadparcour.Monster
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICollision, IScore
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Cat, Princess, Turtle

    public abstract class Monster
extends GravatiyGameObject
implements IScore, ICollision
    The class for all Monstercreatures
    Author:
    Thomas Kool & Max Groenendijk

      • Monster

        public Monster(MoveableGameObject target,
               int range,
               int speed)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        target - the target that the monster will attack (toad)
        range - the ranges at which the monster can spot its target
        speed - the speed the monster will move

      • update

        public void update()
        Description copied from class: MoveableGameObject
        The update-method will be called every cycle of the game loop. Override this method to give an object any time driven behaviour.
        Note: Always call super.update() first in your overrides, because the default update does some important actions, like moving the object.
        Overrides:
        update in class MoveableGameObject
        See Also:
        GameObject.update()

      • collisionOccurred

        public void collisionOccurred(java.util.List<TileCollision> collidedTiles)
        Tile collision: monster bounces off all tiles, so use first collision
        Specified by:
        collisionOccurred in interface ICollision
        Parameters:
        collidedTiles - List of TileCollision holding all tile collisions in this move.
        See Also:
        ICollision.collisionOccurred(java.util.List)
